title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 15): Power With Tenant Organizing - Building Collective Strength for Housing Justice
summary: Organize tenant unions as networks of neighbors who coordinate without domination to resist housing exploitation. Build shared strength through collective action and mutual support.

Power.summary: Build collective tenant power to resist landlord exploitation and housing injustice.

level0: Start conversations with neighbors about shared housing concerns
Identify specific, concrete issues to address collectively
level1: Create working group using consensus decision-making
Build your base through door-to-door organizing
level2: Take collective action - petitions, group letters, protests
Connect to wider tenant organizing movement
level3: Support other neighborhoods in starting tenant unions

Community.summary: Create solidarity networks that provide mutual support and collective resistance.

level0: Use shared leadership and rotate responsibilities
Make meetings accessible and transparent to all tenants
level1: Practice accountability through transparency in all decisions
Protect against co-optation by maintaining autonomy
level2: Center voices of tenants facing eviction and harassment
Build mutual aid networks for housing emergencies
level3: Model Power With organizing for broader housing justice movement

Knowledge.summary: Learn tenant rights and organizing skills while sharing knowledge horizontally.

level0: Learn local tenant rights and rent control laws
level1: Develop skills in door-to-door organizing and base building
Learn conflict resolution and campaign strategy
level2: Teach other tenants about their rights and organizing
Share knowledge about horizontal organizing methods
level3: Train new tenant organizers across multiple neighborhoods
Create educational resources about tenant power building

Narrative.summary: Challenge narratives that individualize housing struggles and promote collective solutions.

level0: Practice framing housing as collective right, not individual commodity
Share stories about successful tenant organizing
level1: Challenge landlord narratives about property rights vs human rights
level2: Help others understand housing justice as community issue
level3: Transform community understanding of housing from commodity to commons
Build culture where tenant organizing is normalized
